title: Psychoactive Herbs in Veterinary Behavior Medicine
cleaned_text: No hay productos en el carrito Psychoactive Herbs in Veterinary Behavior Medicine Schwartz, S. 1ª Edición Septiembre 2005 Inglés Tapa dura 400 pags 1200 gr null x null x null cm ISBN 9780813822990 Editorial WILEY LIBRO IMPRESO 114,91 €109,16 €IVA incluido Recíbelo en un plazo De 2 a 3 semanas LIBRO ELECTRÓNICO 101,91 €96,81 €IVA incluido Descarga inmediata tras realizar la compra The phenomenal growth of public interest in alternatives to Western treatments for human disease has spilled over into veterinary medicine. Many holistic veterinarians and pet owners are now interested in using Herbs Veterinary Medicine is the first text on psychoactive herbal remedies for the treatment of behavior problems in small animals. Psychoactive Herbs in behavior medicine. In addition, pet owners interested in alternative medicine for their misbehaving pets can use this well-rounded work to make informed on the remedies. Description Preface. Disclaimer and Overview. Foreward (Dr. Susan Wynn, Dr. Phil Rogers. CH 1 Western Psychoactive Herbs. - Agaricus Species and Other Medicinal Mushrooms. - The Five Elements. - The Three Doshas (Tridoshas) and Twenty Gunas. - The Seven Dhatus. - The Seven Chakras. - Ayurveda and Psychiatry (Rauwolfia serpentina). - Ayurveda Psychoactive Herbs. - Introduction. - Historical Perspective of Traditional Chinese Medicine. - Basic Principles of TCM :. - Qi,. - Yin and Yang,. - Zang and Fu,. - The Five Tastes,. - The Five Elements,. - Use of Herbs in TCM,. - Angelica sinensis - Schisandra chinensis (Wu wei zi),. - Zingiber officinale Chinese Herbs:. - Aconitum spp. Pinellia ternata Poria - Scutellaria baicalensis (Huang 2: General Index.
